header.topics: health, Green Party, jobs, boot sales, relationships.
header.activity: Friends talking about news, personal situation

body.u: hi so what er kind of day have you had?
I've had a a varied day I have erm er I was and I've been to the doctor and erm
that was about my Dupuytren's Contracture
do you take those for it?

no no er I wish I could but it is a erm a I suppose it's a disease but it's a condition where erm collagen builds up in the hand er and attaches itself to the various erm er bits on the hand and causes the hand to contract
the tendons to contract and pull the the hand into a claw
oh so you walk walk around with your hand in a claw mm scaring young ladies?
I wouldn't want to scare young ladies no no erm so
well it's funny you should say that cos has got the same thing
but he's he's not worried about it cos but he he's retired so
he doesn't have to work so and it doesn't cause him any discomfort
oh right yeah but it does get worse I mean
it's better to get it sorted out before it gets worse
I think he said he already had an operation on the other hand
and took about five to five to six weeks to recover
oh I wouldn't mind chatting to him about that
just got a text through here one new message oh right it's er from my ex girlfriend well still my girlfriend but we're not er

oh we're friends yeah we're not erm we're not sleeping together erm and yeah so the doctor arranged for me to have a an operation or or to rather to see a specialist erm and she asked me about my diabetes er which I talked about erm she er offered me statins but I said to control my erm er what is it? my erm cholesterol levels

but I said to her look we've left it until my next sort of large check up in February and I'm going to go and erm er I'm going to try this diet to get my weight down in the next erm sort of six weeks to get get get er some weight loss going on
so erm see how it goes then and er yeah that's it erm and I told her about the pains in my shoulders er which she didn't offer any input to
I don't know I think it could be erm higher sugar levels attacking the muscles that's what happens in diabetes
oh it's er and it's related to the diabetes?
yeah I mean I'm in danger of er terrible things with diabetes if I don't watch it
losing my limbs yeah oh very serious it's a very serious diabetes is a very serious thing very serious
do you take it seriously? cos you don't seem to you know
well I I keep a check on my figures well I did in her office I checked my figures and it was nine point six after erm after about an hour and a half after I'd had my breakfast
yeah it wasn't too bad I mean it could could have been a bit better but it wasn't bad yeah wasn't bad but whereas I should be about when I wake up in the morning about four sosomething like that
I sh it's probably about seven so erm I should er I've got to keep an eye on it but I let I've let it go recently I've let I I've let it go because I haven't erm
Christmas erm yeah but I shall focus on it again
and er yeah I'll focus on it again so I went to the doctor's I left the doctor's and er what did I do then? erm I think I came home and er
saw you erm I think I had a coffee and a and a bun
what what about that canvassing? you know you it didn't work out because somebody didn't turn up and you've got to do it tomorrow?

yes I went to canvassing I canvass on behalf of the Green Party and er I turned up to er canvass on behalf of who's the leader of the Green Party and erm but er I don't think I got the time and the place wrong but no-one turned up erm
did he he er give you any explanation?

well I can't I haven't yet contacted the person who er who erm who asked me who contacted me in the first place I've just got an email or not an email erm a text through from another councillor to tell me
erm the telephone number of the person that they believe who co-ordinates 's
campaign so I shall text them to say is it you I'm supposed to be speaking to? erm and er if so
why why are they doing why are they doing this so early? cos the election's in May isn't it?
probably but I mean why not now? it's a continuous thing it starts off if you
what's the point of canvassing? you try and basically persuade people to vote for you? I mean is that what you do?
and you're deciding how you're gonna vote

er you meet different types of people you meet the person who says I don't wanna know about it f off and you get really agitated and annoyed then you meet people who erm go oh yes wonderful I voted I will always vote Green fantastic then you meet people who er who ask you loads of questions they drive you mad question after question and er you can get trapped by these people erm just talking and talking and talking so I generally
well they'll go on and on
they're trying to be clever and prove a point
and they're probably very very lonely people who who never get people walking up to them and saying hello with a smiling face and saying how are you?

and whwhat's your opinion? and er you know so they they want a friend and that's nice but if you're going to try and reach a lot of people you can't like a doctor you can't devote that much time to to them er but you can er but that's all part of learning how to canvass well I think er knowing how to let them go how to let them go feeling good about themselves erm I normally say well look er er and and I'm qui er look er you're obviously very interested in this which is fantastic er I would go and look on the website and I will give them the website details and they'll hopefully we we've got another supporter and I say to to th as well would you be prepared to give an hour of your time a week to something if you care about the planet and the people on it an hour of your time just licking envelopes or or putting out some flyers? er but you know you could do something because you meet people and broaden your horizons learn a bit about ecological er issues peace issues erm
so er yeah there's that type and there's

not really but if I go and do some work and he's not there then you know I'll feel that I've done more than he has

well he he would argue that that erm it it's it's just better if I don't get into the position of that argument if I just go yeah I'm not feeling too good either it's just simpler to do that because

working on my own I find quite lonely sometimes
unless there is a a financial erm drive if there's a financial er iimpetus er yeah if there's if I know I can go and oh well actually I am going in to work tomorrow

you can do the work afterwards

where do I sell them exactly?
oh I thou oh I thought you had people in mind when you buy them where you could

she's got to clear all the stuff out of the shop that she's got in there to redecorate and it would be nice for her to set everything out erm
have you ever thought about getting a shop and buying and selling stuff?

well I have but the it's er it's a big commitment erm you've got to sit unless you've got a shop in a very busy place where you've got lots of people coming in and out and and like a gift shop something like that on seafront selling objet d'art would be good down there you know but it's er places in a seaside town that you're aiming for for turnover from the general public IE holiday makers really depends on the weather and some years you can actually s take virtually nothing the whole year because er the weather's so appalling certainly if it's in a place where the that only really caters for the sun seekers or tourists it's erm sometimes in the winter it can be completely dead

so it's quite difficult looking for a market if you deal in really really upmarket pieces you've got to get get you've got to find the the market and and erm and and go for market I mean if you have really top dollar stuff in a shop erm you can't put any rubbish in there you can't put anything for a fiver in there people people you lose credibility it's all got to be magnificent quality
you you were saying you were saying earlier that like erm
you you er you you hate work or hate working well whwhat?

I'm tir I don't hate it I'm tired of it I've worked very hard all my life since I was fifteen and er grafted a lot and I'm get getting old I'm sixty four this year sixty-four this year and I'm getting aches and pains and I I I've had my family I've had my life I've had my child I've I've had it all and now it's my time before I die it's my time it's time for me to give myself those little things like a an afternoon in the country walking a dog I'd like a dog I can't have one cos I work
